title: Prinz Salm 2017 Grünschiefer Riesling (Nahe)
description: Dusty mineral and dried-herb notes on the nose contrast pristine lemon, lime and white grapefruit flavors on the palate of this silky dry Riesling. It's a mouthwatering but elegant wine with a stony, slaty finish.

title: Purple Hands 2016 Kropf Vineyard Pinot Noir (Dundee Hills)
description: Blueberries and currants come with a lemony edge in this aromatic, rather delicate wine. Refined highlights add citrus rind, and as it breathes there's a nice cherry component also.

title: Régine Baron 2010 Cuvée Topaz Millésime Brut  (Champagne)
description: Now mature, this rich wine is beautifully balanced. Ripe fruitiness contrasts with minerality and a tight texture. The touches of toast and lively acidity are part of the maturing process of the wine. Drink now, although it will be better from 2020.

title: Rui Roboredo Madeira 2015 Quinta do Côa Red (Douro)
description: Made from organically grown grapes in the dry Douro Superior region of prehistoric Côa, the wine is a generous blend of Touriga Nacional, Tinta Roriz and Touriga Franca. Is firm tannins give the wine a dry edge which is mitigated by the ripe black fruits and spicy flavors from wood aging. Drink this serious wine from 2020.

title: Sean W. McBride 2016 Gremlin Vineyard Pinot Noir (Los Carneros)
description: This is a bright and lightly layered wine that offers tones of Asian spice, earth and black tea. The acidity is tart and tenacious, interwoven between gentle jolts of mint, chocolate and dark cherry.

title: Shea 2016 Shea Vineyard Block 7 Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)
description: This block selection is 100% Wadenswil clone, 13% whole cluster fermented, and aged in 50% new French oak. Strawberry and blueberry fruit plays out broadly across the palate, with notes of root beer and cola. It's open and forward, quite tasty, though not as dense or complex as some of Shea's other selections.

title: Siduri 2016 Sierra Mar Vineyard Pinot Noir (Santa Lucia Highlands)
description: Elegantly layered aromas of rose petal potpourri, cranberry, raspberry and sandalwood arise on the nose of this single-vineyard study. Creamy and soft with well-integrated acid on the palate, this wine offers flavors of plum and mulberry, making for a smooth sip.

title: Sierra Cantabria 2011 Reserva  (Rioja)
description: Oak-rich aromas of maple, chocolate and vanilla rest on top of ripe berry scents. This is a medium-deep Rioja with bouncy tannins and lively acidity. Flavors of blackberry and cassis show a flowery hint of violet on a finish with depth and character. Drink through 2026.

title: Tomero 2015 Gran Reserva Malbec (Mendoza)
description: Smoky, savory aromas of grilled beef, graphite, clove and baked fruit are the opening on this saturated Malbec. Baked black cherry, blackberry and cassis flavors are compact prior to finish, with strong acidity and tannins. Drink through 2022.

title: Upsidedown 2016 The Gold Drop Collection Kitzke Vineyards Mourvèdre (Columbia Valley (WA))
description: Heaping amounts of black pepper and raw meat aromas are followed by pillowy soft dark fruit and savory flavors that remain light on their feet, stretching out on the finish. It's a compelling offering of the variety.
designation: The Gold Drop Collection Kitzke Vineyards

title: Salmon 2013 Special Club Rosé de Saignée Zéro Dosage  (Champagne)
description: This small-production wine is rare for another reason: it is 100% Pinot Meunier. The producer, based in the Vallée de la Marne, has made a dark-colored rosé, softly textured although with considerable acidity. A young, fruity wine, it will be better from 2020.
designation: Special Club Rosé de Saignée Zéro Dosage

title: Global Wines 2017 Cabriz Reserva Encruzado (Dão)
description: The wood aging has made a world of difference to this fruity wine. It has added complexity to the white fruits and acidity and give the wine fine depth of flavor. Toast and spice show strongly as well as a rich aftertaste. Drink the wine from 2019.

title: Jean-Noël Haton NV Blanc de Blancs Brut Chardonnay (Champagne)
description: This producer based in Damery in the Marne Valley has made a well-balanced wine, poised between minerality, acidity and white fruits. Tangy, zesty and fruity, it is ready to drink now.

title: Adega Mayor 2013 Pai Chão Grande Reserva Red (Alentejano)
description: This wine is immense but manages to also have an elegant side. That comes from the fine balance between acidity and the concentrated black fruits from the Alicante Bouschet. Wood aging and ripe juiciness give the wine a lift and, again, restrain the huge power backed by 15% alcohol. The wine is ready to drink.

title: Alexana 2016 West Blocks-Sedimentary Soils Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)
description: This block selection shines in 2016, sneaking up on the taster with flavors that build concentration through the finish. Black cherry, chocolate and a hint of mint all combine, and the overall balance argues for further bottle aging before popping the cork. Drink from 2022 on through the decade.

title: Alexana 2017 Revana Vineyard Riesling (Dundee Hills)
description: This estate-grown bottling is ripe and juicy, with a luscious mix of orange and grapefruit flavors, along with a generous slice of melon. The mouthfeel is lightly creamy, and there's a suggestion of some residual sugar, though it is not specifically indicated.

title: Alexana 2017 Terroir Series Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)
description: This is part of the winery's Terroir Series, but oddly, no specific terroir other than the generic Willamette Valley AVA is indicated. The flavors are leesy and balanced among fruit highlights of citrus, lime and papaya, with a strong minerality. Precise and stylish, it's already drinking quite well and should hold through 2023.

title: Anne Amie 2016 Winemaker's Selection Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)
description: This aromatic young wine brings a mix of cherries and figs, with highlights of hazelnuts. Aged 10 months in one-sixth new French oak, it lightly suggests Snickers bars and malted milk ball candies, without overdoing either. Overall it's refined and well balanced, and should be consumed now–2025.

title: Antichi Poderi dei Gallina 2015 Gallina  (Barbaresco)
description: This has aromas suggesting dark-skinned berry, leather, exotic spice and a balsamic whiff of menthol. The solid palate shows morello cherry, cinnamon and licorice alongside fine-grained tannins. Drink 2021–2029.

title: Besserat de Bellefon NV Cuvée des Moines Blanc de Blancs Grand Cru Brut Chardonnay (Champagne)
description: Mineral, textured, rich and full of white-fruit flavors, this wine is taut and nervy with intense acidity that is balanced by the ripeness. This bottling, with its tight texture, needs to age. Drink from 2019.
designation: Cuvée des Moines Blanc de Blancs Grand Cru Brut
